text.__SUMMARY__: Quercus macrolepis, the Valonia oak, the old name for Quercus ithaburensis subsp. macrolepis.
text.Geographical range: It is found  in the Balkans, and in the southern and eastern Mediterranean, including the Greek Islands, Turkey, Israel, and Morocco.
text.Uses: The cups, known as valonia, are used for tanning and dyeing as are the unripe acorns called camata or camatina. The ripe acorns are eaten raw or boiled.
